wikitext.*:
'''''Ar-''''' or '''''ara-''''' is a prefix in [[Quenya]] and [[Sindarin]] used to confer nobility or royalty.<ref>{{S|Appendix}}, ''ar(a)-''</ref>  It was a prefixed form of the stem Quenya/Sindarin ''[[aran]]'', referring to a king.<ref>{{PM|XI4}}, p. 344</ref>

The [[Númenoreans]] also had borrowed this prefix in their native [[Adûnaic]] language, used with the names of the [[Kings of Númenor]] (like [[Ar-Pharazôn]]); however when they still took Quenya names, they used the prefix '''[[Tar]]-''' (like [[Tar-Elendil]]).

When the royal line of [[Arnor]] failed in [[Rhudaur]] and [[Cardolan]], the [[King of Arthedain]] [[Argeleb I]] took a name with this prefix, claiming sovereignty in all former Arnor, as did his descendants.<ref>{{App|North}}, note 4</ref>
==Examples==
* ''[[Fingolfin#Etymology|'''Ara'''cáno]]'' = "High Chieftain"
* ''[[Malach#Etymology|'''Ara'''dan]]'' = "Noble Man"
* ''[[Finarfin#Etymology|'''Ara'''finwë]]'' = "Noble Finwë"
* ''[[Araglas#Etymology|'''Ara'''glas]]'' = "Royal Joy"
* ''[[Aragorn#Etymology|'''Ara'''gorn]]'' = "Revered King"
* ''[[Arathorn II#Etymology|'''Ara'''thorn]]'' = "Eagle King"
* ''[[Arnor#Etymology|'''Ar'''nor]]'' = "Land of the King"
* ''[[Arwen#Etymology|'''Ar'''wen]]'' = "Noble Maiden"
